list_definition.definition: the deep rumbling sound heard in the sky after a flash of lightning

list_definition.mean_english: gây ra tiếng động vang to
list_definition.definition: to make a noise like thunder

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The tanks thundered over the bridge.

list_ex_of_english: Therefore, people living in completely residential areas could be faced, for an unspecified time, with thundering lorries passing their front doors.
One woman pushing a pram had to dive into a hedge when a lorry came thundering round the corner.
People have had to be patient and grit their teeth as heavy lorries have thundered past on roads which were never designed for them.
If they are, that will be a thundering disgrace.
Day in, day out a vast amount of commuter traffic also thunders through, as well as heavy goods vehicles and dangerous overweight juggernauts.
The thunder and lightning storm is a real one coming across from the mainland.
We would restore life to many of our villages by getting rid of the traffic which thunders through them.
Let us be honest: when a conflict comes, the families will be a thundering nuisance immediately behind the front line.
